thread.title: Colts' fabulous fourth quarter leads to 42-28 win over Raiders
thread.title_full: Colts' fabulous fourth quarter leads to 42-28 win over Raiders

title: Colts' fabulous fourth quarter leads to 42-28 win over Raiders
text:
The Indianapolis Colts (3-5) smotherthe Oakland Raiders in the fourth quarter to win 42-28.
Andrew Luck passes for 239 yards and 3 touchdowns, each to a different tight end (that's an NFL first). Marlon Mack rushes for a career-best 132 yards, with 2 TDs. The Colts rush for 222yards as Nyheim Hines adds 78.
Adam Vinatierei becomesthe NFL's career scoring leader.
Fourth quarter
Raiders are at their 43 at the 2-minute warning.
MarlonMack goes in from 1yard with 2:55 to go. Raiders are down 21-0 in the quarter, -51 in fourth-quarter scoring for the season.Colts 42, Raiders 28
Marlon Mack establishes another career high, with 128 rushing yards on 23 carries.
Colts force a fumble -- Darius Leonard punches the ball from Doug Martin's grasp -- and recover from Oakland's 27 with 5:16 to go.
Raiders start from their 20.
Jack Doyle powers in for a 10-yard TD after taking the screen from Andrew Luck with 5:28 left. Doyle has 4 catches for 52 yards on the drive, which goes 57 yards in 6 plays over 3:52. That's an NFL first: 3 tight ends from the same team with a TD in the same game.Colts 35, Raiders 28
Jack Doyle has 3 catches in a span of 4 plays.
Colts have it at their 43 with 9:20 left.
Oakland goes 3-and-out as Derek Carr overthrows a receiver on third-and-3.
Raiders start from their 25.
Indy defense hasn't stopped Oakland (except for the end of the first half) since the first quarter.
Marlon Mack goes over 100 yards for the day on a 4-yard TD with 10:47 left. He's 17 for 101. Drive is 11 plays, 71 yards over 5:11. Colts 28, Raiders 28
Erik Harris almost intercepts Andrew Luck in the end zone. Third and goal from the 4.
T.Y. Hilton's first catch is a 24-yarder to Oakland's 15-yard line.
Andrew Luck hits Jack Doyle for a first down.
Third quarter
Dontrelle Inman is catching everything, even off the deflection from Zach Pascal, to end the quarter. Inman has 6 catches for 52 yards.
Colts start from their 25.
Derek Carr evades the rush and hits Brandon LaFell for a 6-yard touchdown with 1:01 left. Raiders 28, Colts 21
Mike Mitchell is questionable with a calf injury. The safety was AFC Defensive Player of the Week against Buffalo in his second game in Indy.
Raiders start at their 25.
Andrew Luck hits Eric Ebron for a 20-yard touchdown with 7:39 to go. A pass to Chester Rogers on the conversion ties it. That's 7 Ebron TDs this year. Colts strike for 75 yards on 4 plays. Raiders 21, Colts 21
Marlon Mack starts the drive with a 49-yard run.
Colts start at their 25.
On the coach's challenge, Derek Carr gets in from 1 yard for a touchdown with 10:21 left. Drive is 8 plays, 75 yards, 5:11.Raiders 21, Colts 13
Oakland shreds the Indy defense again and forces another offside on Derek Carr's hard count. This time on Margus Hunt.
Raiders start from their 25.
Halftime
Two strong Oakland drives resultin touchdowns. Derek Carr is 8-of-11 for 117 yards and 2 TDs.
Andrew Luck is 14-of-20 for 108 yards and a TD. The Colts have 107 rushing yards. Good balance. Adam Vinatieri sets the NFL career scoring record.
Second quarter
Adam Vinatieri's 24-yard field goal gives him 2,547 career points, the most in NFL history. Raiders 14, Colts 13 with 26 seconds left.
Luck's pass to T.Y. Hilton is broken up in the end zone with 29 seconds left.
Nyheim Hines runs for several plays (he has 5 carries for 47 yards) as the Colts drive to Oakland's 7. Timeout with 39 seconds left. Colts have 107 rushing yards before halftime.
Pass rush is heavy and Andrew Luck takes a hit, but he completes a 10-yard pass to Dontrelle Inman for the first down just before the 2-minute warning. Colts at Oakland 44.
Colts start at their 25.
Derek Carr hits Jared Cook for 25 yards with6:13 to go. Carr has 7 straight completions. Drive is 7 plays, 79 yards, 4:28. Raiders 14, Colts 10
Colts have been offside twice on this Oakland drive. Raiders are into Colts territory.
Colts go 3-and-out and punt. Oakland starts at its 20.
Colts start at their 25. Ryan Kelly at center is back after getting his right middle finger heavily taped.
Derek Carr hits Seth Roberts for an easy 31-yard touchdown with 12:21 to go. Drive is 6 plays, 75 yards, 3:04. Colts 10, Raiders 7
Oakland has 2 first downs, crosses into Colts territory.
Raiders will start at their 25.
First quarter
Adam Vinatieri ties the NFL scoring record with 26-yarder on the the final play of the quarter. He has 2,544 points, just like Morten Andersen. Oakland ran 3 plays in the first quarter.Colts 10, Raiders 0
Incomplete to Dontrelle Inman in the end zone:11-for-12.
Oakland blows up a Colts play but commits a personal foul on the tackle.
Andrew Luck is 10-for-10 passing for 87 yards.
Center Ryan Kelly leaves the game with a hand injury and Evan Boehm is in. Kelly is questionable to return.
Raiders go 3-and-out, and the Colts get the ball at their 22 after a punt.
Raiders start from their 25.
Mo Alie-Cox makes the leaping one-handed grab for his first career touchdown, for 26 yards with 8:21 to go. Adam Vinatieri is now 4 points shy of the NFL scoring record. Drive is 11 plays, 75 yards, 6:39.Colts 7, Raiders 0
Colts are 5th in the NFL coming in on converting third down and 3 yards or less. Marlon Mack converts third and a foot.
Jack Doyle gets his first catch since Week 2, a screen for 8 yards into Oakland territory.
On the opening play, Dontrelle Inman gets his first career reception, for 6 yards. (Former Colts Rashaan Melvin is a healthy scratch for Oakland.)
Colts will start from their 25. (Daniel Carlson is Oakland's fourth kicker this season.)
Pregame coverage
Adam Vinatieri is 5 points from setting the NFL scoring record, and his pursuit continues today. Also, running back Marlon Mack and tight end Jack Doyle are active. Doyle (hip) last played in Week 2.
Andrew Luck's pregame look is more subdued this week.
Preview coverage
Colts vs. Raiders:Look for Luck to dice up awful Oakland D
Key matchup:Colts have struggled against tight ends, have to stop Jared Cook
Doyel:Dream of a lifetime for Colts radio voice Matt Taylor
Former coach:Chuck Pagano lands NFL job, has his eye on a different one
